document.title: Fairfax County Public Schools Prealgebra/Mathematics 7 Honors Yearly Overview

E788134D50614F59B8DCFDCF29A47F21.description: Given at least one dimension as an algebraic expression, solve area and perimeter problems using a multistep equation.

C48FAF8FA056471CBF823CFAAE7A675F.description: Given dimensions as an algebraic expression, represent the area or perimeter of a polygon with an algebraic expression.

D5319E41A5794BB0B5CD84A545CB5AB1.description: Apply perimeter, circumference, and area formulas to solve contextual problems involving composite plane figures.

48430805B2E84717BE486B8D32EF9A80.description: Subdivide a plane figure into triangles, rectangles, squares, trapezoids, parallelograms, and semicircles. Use the attributes of the subdivisions to determine the perimeter of the composite plane figure

E43A996BA8E04C2BB7AC4729BA0198BE.description: Subdivide a plane figure into triangles, rectangles, squares, trapezoids, parallelograms, circles, and semicircles. Determine the area of subdivisions and combine to determine the area of the composite plane figure.

13C496F4334E4BCB8F547942BBB1C245.description: The student will solve area and perimeter problems involving composite plane figures, including those in context.

2E0ABD1BA1D6402199F69B7F7BB54DDE.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve complex problems to determine the side lengths.

65DD561DD86546C1928219275721ECB8.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem, and its converse, to solve problems involving right triangles in context.

153F89D00E7F4C11A40A14F7598213E1.description: Determine the measure of a side of a right triangle, given the measures of the other two sides.

80C7E4807C164049BF01BBCA1122C3C7.description: Identify the parts of a right triangle (the hypotenuse and the legs) given figures in various orientations.

4A8CE3A835DA475FB876AB9F227DD299.description: Determine whether a triangle is a right triangle given the measures of its three sides.

13120E719A8D4A93AD55AAF992C391C2.description: Verify the Pythagorean Theorem using diagrams, concrete materials, and measurement.

9BCEFC82A42843DBAC41729518253B79.description: The student will apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve problems involving right triangles, including those in context.

963FC8CDF2F9441EB4E77614865E64AD.description: Formulate and use rules for dilations, translations, and reflections on the coordinate plane.

AA398643749F4ADC859FD11914CB90F2.description: Identify and describe transformations in context (e.g., tiling, fabric, wallpaper designs, art).

37B7C0E6294A453E832E2F4CEF81FCB7.description: Sketch the image of a polygon that has been translated and reflected over the x- or y-axis, or reflected over the x- or y-axis and then translated.

C9A14A31D6AA4C66A09B9864B694B1D8.description: Sketch the image of a polygon that has been reflected over the x- or y-axis.

9E829693E6ED4892AC6F04C2DF3B4F34.description: Sketch the image of a polygon that has been translated vertically, horizontally, or a combination of both.

7499AD9CEC364EB5AEF26E0B15AC4C99.description: Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon that has been translated and reflected over the x- or y-axis or reflected over the x- or y-axis and then translated.

8E27BA1D060B47A7A4AF8B3A3BD1CFB2.description: Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon that has been reflected over the x- or y-axis.

0664F096943646B1B4040661B4A63D3C.description: Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon that has been translated vertically, horizontally, or a combination of both.

DB513E9BA5314F6F8E44A8C6EDFC121E.description: The student will apply translations and reflections to polygons in the coordinate plane.

28CBAD879AC44F008613CD8F17067A0D.description: Solve problems about the surface area of square-based pyramids and the volume of cones and square-based pyramids that require finding a missing dimension, including the application of the Pythagorean Theorem.

CC7903130F264C24BD2200C1377CA840.description: Determine a missing dimension given the surface area of square-based pyramids or the volume of cones and square-based pyramids.

EF1C83C71EA9417D86144B0934581132.description: Solve problems in context involving volume of cones and square-based pyramids and the surface area of square-based pyramids.

E0D3F01FB5A349789ABCE136225B6782.description: Examine and explain the relationship between the volume of cones and cylinders, and the volume of rectangular prisms and square based pyramids.

14331AD237534C219226A2AB45A62A23.description: Determine the volume of cones and square-based pyramids, using concrete objects, diagrams, and formulas.

C0EBB0F1CBC048BF94172089274B2127.description: Determine the surface area of square-based pyramids by using concrete objects, nets, diagrams, and formulas.

40599A57CFCF437AB633628A3CBD115D.description: The student will investigate and determine the surface area of square-based pyramids and the volume of cones and square-based pyramids.

B5E744BAB702428680D1DB54E100158B.description: Solve problems about the relationships of angles where unknown angle measures are given as expressions.

981E771E787F4694A263A334126B8C7E.description: Use the relationships among supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles to solve problems, including those in context, involving the measure of unknown angles.

5ABDBD3BC8A9458BB28B22C6EDB41B6C.description: Identify and describe the relationship between pairs of angles that are vertical, adjacent, supplementary, and complementary.

84BAD7333CC944CFB83687179850BA1F.description: The student will use the relationships among pairs of angles that are vertical angles, adjacent angles, supplementary angles, and complementary angles to determine the measure of unknown angles.

42800517DB0E42A587F3BC28E9C8DAB7.description: After using an inequality to solve a problem in context, describe what assumptions or parameters are implied in the solution and represent the solution more precisely with words, numbers, symbols, and/or graphs.

BC809FD68F5D4225AE915E35C7D72325.description: Interpret algebraic solutions in context to linear inequalities in one variable.

28C34C6C7B3C4B2F962ABD40027E6EFC.description: Identify a numerical value(s) that is part of the solution set of a given inequality.

AEDD8459FD5442558716D26D89A96AFB.description: Solve problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear inequality in one variable.

043B9A72904A45A79A763D3E76AC45B7.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a multistep linear inequality in one variable.

56DF363046FC402A919FAE880D8CC1DF.description: Write multi-step linear inequalities in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including those in context.

DD0969E06FBD451188658146282707EF.description: Represent solutions to inequalities algebraically and graphically using a number line.

5C9BA9E4E56B4C66A7FF3F38290E631C.description: Apply properties of real numbers and properties of inequality to solve multi-step linear inequalities (up to four steps) in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the inequality. Coefficients and numeric terms will be rational. Inequalities may contain expressions that need to be expanded (using the distributive property) or require combining like terms to solve.

43ED3F5B023C4CBDB63E597CF301E777.description: The student will write and solve multistep linear inequalities in one variable, including problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear inequality in one variable.

D6FBE55C3CEF4437BEE138E6438CE615.description: Justify a method of solving an equation using the properties of real numbers and the properties of equality.

7391367A66D5402A9B36BCFDE1F44A54.description: Compare and contrast different ways to solve the same equation; synthesize the comparison to describe when different methods are most efficient based on the structure of the equation.

4EF677EB79DC4FF7B438EF2E5C397C56.description: Confirm algebraic solutions to linear equations in one variable.

E71D83B9D1664739A730DFE69E111BB6.description: Interpret algebraic solutions in context to linear equations in one variable.

C58239B2D601474093CA5809B4730BF9.description: Solve problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear equation.

90764D9579844A67ABB59A19535B4E68.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a multistep linear equation in one variable.

918794D4E55E4A7FB512963D8A1D250A.description: Write a multistep linear equation in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including those in context.

F56A38B547D740DC845EAE6F4952456E.description: Apply properties of real numbers and properties of equality to solve multistep linear equations in one variable (up to four steps). Coefficients and numeric terms will be rational. Equations may contain expressions that need to be expanded (using the distributive property) or require combining like terms to solve.

B06A36D419E54BEF8D788FDFEBB973E1.description: Represent and solve multistep linear equations in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the equation (up to four steps) using a variety of concrete materials and pictorial representations.

7D04F6E301F94B328BB3E1B5AD713A2A.description: The student will write and solve multistep linear equations in one variable, including problems in context that require the solution of a multistep linear equation in one variable.

4A4D1140FFF2420288D61931EFDBD628.description: Describe the characteristics of horizontal and vertical lines, including the slope, and intercept, whether itâ€™s a function, and the general form of the equation; given a graph, table, or equation of a horizontal or vertical line, create the other two representations.

3D7CBEBF187C448A9DB0481617A4D781.description: Given the graph or table of a contextual linear relationship, identify the x-intercept in addition to the y- intercept; interpret its meaning in the context of the relationship. (The x- and y- intercepts will be included in the graph or table.)

ABE30BE119FE4EBBB18EC8BE687CCEBD.description: Given one representation of a problem in context, describe the effect of changing the slope/rate of change or the y-intercept on the other representations (graph, table, equation, or verbal description).

E6F4644F79184C75B8DC41D60F946408.description: Create a context for a linear function given a graph, table, or equation in the form y=mx+b.

6BE2224B5F644B68A9592F72A927FD43.description: Write an equation of a linear function in the form y = mx + b, given a graph, table, or a situation in context.

170D3139B844419B960B13B07CF821A7.description: Create a table of values for a linear function given a graph, equation in the form of y = mx + b, or context.

DC69040B0C8B409DBFF8D1DD1C7A236A.description: Graph a linear function given a table, equation, or a situation in context.

EF7424B890954B51A5504B6E5245BFCA.description: Describe key characteristics of linear functions including slope (m), y-intercept (b), and independent and dependent variables.

9C27F7B387B54C969718B8EC9B87C65B.description: Determine how adding a constant (b) to the equation of a proportional relationship y = mx will translate the line on a graph.

5A81C2C833C14467B6D0466E4337AE7B.description: The student will represent and solve problems, including those in context, by using linear functions and analyzing their key characteristics (the value of the y-intercept (b) and the coordinates of the ordered pairs in graphs will be limited to integers).

76E2410E3DDA48019741ACE4F26B7A24.description: Identify the domain and range of a function represented as a set of ordered pairs, a table, or a graph of discrete points.

E58BCCC6D8C34A40A759B47D6C102D82.description: Determine whether a relation, represented by a set of ordered pairs, a table, or a graph of discrete points is a function. Sets are limited to no more than 10 ordered pairs.

BD6884197ADE443A8822F1C47C990FB9.description: The student will determine whether a given relation is a function and determine the domain and range of a function.

C5F79F0C51564DAEAF22600092CE9B66.description: Given a pictorial representation of a pattern, represent the pattern with an algebraic expression; justify the algebraic expression by connecting parts of the expression with the pictorial representation. Patterns will be limited to linear and quadratic patterns.

A67909CF61C44B8BB086F51C922A3733.description: Make connections between applying the distributive property with rational numbers and division of algebraic expressions with a monomial divisor; simplify expressions that are written as the division of algebraic expressions with a numerical divisor. Algebraic expressions will be limited to quadratic, linear, and/or numeric terms.

49633CED40654D92ADC1891284F397B6.description: Simplify and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in one or two variables using the distributive property or by combining like terms. Each term will only have one variable; expressions may include terms quadratic, linear, and/or constant terms.

8B24F55EB88B41C0805EB7485675A6B2.description: Simplify numerical expressions or evaluate algebraic expressions that include positive and negative exponents and a whole number base.

F4153734438F47D0B4FE3224E8E5D81E.description: Simplify and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in one variable by applying the order of operations and properties of real numbers. Expressions may need to be expanded (using the distributive property) or require combining like terms to simplify. Expressions will include only linear and numeric terms. Coefficients and numeric terms may be rational.

D81E87F0B13F49CDBEC400A7FAC87948.description: Represent algebraic expressions using concrete manipulatives or pictorial representations (e.g., colored chips, algebra tiles), including expressions that apply the distributive property.

224234CD11A84B63907488BC2448E74B.description: The student will represent, simplify, and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in one variable.

6E780D539D7A43C4B8F868E3910A839B.description: Use different representations to solve contextual problems that require the computation of more than one percentage, including compound interest without a formula.

714BC5C2FBE940C782ABF6CAAD959630.description: Use different representations to solve contextual problems that require the computation of the original price, given the final price and the percentage of one discount, markup, tax, or tip.

A7E695868B2D422AAC8E61A56884ABF9.description: Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of the percent increase or decrease.

4AB602FDD0E04F97AFBFCCB5E6F29ECA.description: Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of the sales tax, tip and resulting total.

E5707A5559FE462B8A613F40273F4393.description: Estimate and solve contextual problems that require the computation of one discount or markup and the resulting sale price.

1D4D97583FAB460A82ED8A185868827F.description: The student will estimate and apply proportional reasoning and computational procedures to solve contextual problems.

5FDA993544894672B2B1C227D7544267.description: Use problem solving and reasoning to solve problems with Venn diagrams.

B1C44FF118634BCF8779219FB912415E.description: Describe each subset of the set of real numbers and include examples and non-examples.

FF0703F8B53C49858F4A37B4A93D8633.description: Classify and explain why a given number is a member of a particular subset or subsets of the real number system.

376FBB1BB80A4E5BA7575E548F045446.description: Describe and illustrate the relationships among the subsets of the real number system by using representations (e.g., graphic organizers, number lines). Subsets include rational numbers, irrational numbers, integers, whole numbers, and natural numbers.

5CDB780D736C4A58B3BC91C480CFCF0B.description: The student will investigate and describe the relationship between the subsets of the real number system.

DE44D69654EA46609378B4E4AD360810.description: Given two algebraic expressions, determine which one will always be greater, if they are always equivalent, or if it cannot be determined; justify using examples and counterexamples.

B99EEA291F1240238F8A36B5969892CC.description: Use patterns to determine and justify equivalent values for numerical expressions with a positive or negative integer exponent and a whole number base.

F106C3D8525A4EFB9DED0F520B1C403F.description: Describe the density property; given two real numbers, students will apply the density property to identify and represent at least one real number between the given numbers.

8CE4A1A760544E53B9ABE85670D71DE8.description: Use multiple strategies (e.g., benchmarks, number line, equivalency) to compare and order no more than five real numbers expressed as integers, fractions (proper or improper), decimals, mixed numbers, percents, numbers written in scientific notation, radicals, and Ï€. Radicals may include both positive and negative square roots of values from 0 to 400. Ordering may be in ascending or descending order. Justify solutions orally, in writing or with a model.

65BFD27B3ECF4D50AFB9FAA79425C8EE.description: Use rational approximations (to the nearest hundredth) of irrational numbers to compare, order, and locate values on a number line. Radicals may include both positive and negative square roots of values from 0 to 400 yielding an irrational number.

4D2885BE7DF74E7195019167ADE0B444.description: Estimate and identify the two consecutive natural numbers between which the positive square root of a given number lies and justify which natural number is the better approximation. Numbers are limited to natural numbers from 1 to 400.

4AD1078E18CC4B43825D518C357D1E43.description: The student will compare and order real numbers and determine the relationships between real numbers.

7C0BF60FF7444AE4B5ABC9544F160DA1.description: Given a scatterplot that has a non-linear correlation, describe the characteristics of the relationship in words.

0F85E0376EDB41F4B90D544756BA8CDC.description: Describe with precise language why a set of data could or could not be meaningfully displayed in a scatterplot, using terms like categorical, quantitative, univariate, bivariate, relationship between data sets, correlation, or causation.

A926FB577C8D412E9DA46467E9AC9E82.description: Sketch the line of best fit for data represented in a scatterplot.

295FCA1536254507BF2D1EF0DCFB12D1.description: Analyze and justify the relationship of the quantitative bivariate data represented in scatterplots.

2F9A7BDF38ED4EA5B00DA58A7A34DB1E.description: Make observations about a set of data points in a scatterplot as having a positive linear relationship, a negative linear relationship, or no relationship

4338A60799F649108996A069561E683A.description: Organize and represent numeric bivariate data using scatterplots with and without the use of technology.

0C8DD80B47B445A9B3D09C578000B0DE.description: Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire existing data) of no more than 20 items using various methods (e.g., observations, measurement, surveys, experiments).

6F32AF88158749D2845D15D41A211E26.description: Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on scatterplots.

E773758047EA42539D65C376ECD06A78.description: The student will apply the data cycle (formulate questions; collect or acquire data; organize and represent data; and analyze data and communicate results) with a focus on scatterplots.

D61AACE597F44122B7B0F5EEBC48A9A8.description: Given a misleading univariate graphical display, identify the inaccurate conclusions someone might make and describe how to improve the graphical display.

27587FA2215045AAB7C4B72F77CACB40.description: Describe with precise language why a set of data could or could not be meaningfully displayed in a boxplot, using terms like categorical, quantitative, univariate, bivariate, shape, center, or spread.

E8A5AF0DDD36419EA138BADEBFFA5778.description: Identify components of graphical displays that can be misleading.

59140FC6A00E42B6B8683D311783C698.description: Given a contextual situation, justify which graphical representation (e.g., pictographs, bar graphs, line graphs, line plots/dot plots, stem-and-leaf plots, circle graphs, histograms, and boxplots) best represents the data.

AACF1D3533C54697BE4D12F5C9B362F4.description: Compare and analyze two data sets represented in boxplots.

488A50A9F10D46BB8AAF443EAD83907F.description: Analyze data represented in a boxplot by making observations and drawing conclusions.

091DADF42EC549E9B352B5A65024318A.description: Describe how the presence of an extreme data point (outlier) affects the shape and spread of the data distribution of a boxplot.

A5A26764CCC24BB2B5ED6EB3D45E1811.description: Identify and describe the lower extreme (minimum), upper extreme (maximum), median, upper quartile, lower quartile, range, and interquartile range given a data set, represented by a boxplot.

C059E481617E457FADF1270834C6F607.description: Organize and represent a numeric data set of no more than 20 items, using boxplots, with and without the use of technology.

6035E8F6CC9142B6AAD07D719B46F64F.description: Determine how statistical bias might affect whether the data collected from the sample is representative of the larger population.

90361ABCA1D44611A0FA09B90A2026D7.description: Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire existing data) using various methods (e.g., observations, measurement, surveys, experiments).

397312161362427D966E1CF5CC820E8C.description: Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on boxplots.

2ABEF10EC9DD40A59AC3DDD059C04922.description: The student will apply the data cycle (formulate questions; collect or acquire data; organize and represent data; and analyze data and communicate results) with a focus on boxplots.

6B0169501B2847538394C982D37FBC37.description: Given the probability of a compound event, create one or more possible scenarios that would yield that probability.

4D2D66E468884468B7D6D80424CBF87C.description: Determine the probability of two dependent events.

3DB4809887484009A6AD737E5365296C.description: Determine the probability of two independent events.

4FF0A6A9EACE430D8B4CCF270420344B.description: Compare and contrast the probability of independent and dependent events

D03B03E52BE64BC5AF0BE743E7B58AE8.description: Determine whether two events are independent or dependent and explain how replacement impacts the probability.

B9540F012C574BEDAA6E1DE6A0BE65D2.description: The student will use statistical investigation to determine the probability of independent and dependent events, including those in context.
